sections.comment:
Introduksjon

Siden programmeringsspråkene som blir brukt for å beskrive innhold, design og funksjonalitet på høgskolens nettsider er på engelsk er også dokumentasjonen under skrevet på engelsk.

hiof.no design

The university college website have information in both Norwegian and English. The page is consist of a header section, a content section and a footer section. The header and footer sections stay the same throughout the site regardless of the type of content in the content section. The content section have a few different types of page types:

  • Frontpage content
  • Regular page content
  • Faculty/unit frontpages
  • Academy frontpage

Header

The header consist of the brand/logo element and two navigation areas. The brand is placed in the center of the header-area regardless of screen size.

The navigational area to the left of the logo include the main content sections on the page, the course-catalogue with related resources, research pages, about the university college pages and a button to toggle the site wide search. The navigational area to the right of the logo include menu items for internal sites for students and employees and a language selection button to switch between Norwegian and English.

The navigation consist of two different user experiences, one vertical navigation with menu-toggle buttons and the other a horizontal navigation-experience. The vertical navigation is for small to medium screens sizes with the width of the screen lower than 770 pixel. The horizontal navigation is for screens with a width higher than 770px.

Vertical navigation

Main navigation is found in a slid-in navigation accessible through the hamburger-menu button. On the right, there is a button to toggle internal pages for students and employees and to switch language of the page to English.

Design details is described in the header (module documentation not available yet) section.

Horizontal navigation

Main navigation on the left with studies, research, about and search buttons that include dropdown. On the right we have buttons to internal contents for students and employees and language selection.

Design details is described in the header (module documentation not available yet) section.

Footer

The footer include the following section:

  • Breadcrumb section
  • Lists of our faculties, academy and units
  • Other pages owned by the University College
  • Contact information and service hours.
  • A map/location
  • Last updated information related to the specific page you visit + copyright information.

The footer section change form depending on the screen-size of the device used to view the site. On small screens the mentioned content is layout vertically on the order their listed. On medium screens the breadcrumb has its own row, then a row with units and our pages, then a row with contact and the map/location and lastly the last updated + copyright information. On large screens the breadcrumb has their own row, then all the content sections is layout out from left to right in a row and at last the last updated and copyright information have its own row at the bottom.
Footer screenshots

Frontpage content

The frontpage for the university college gets on average 3200 unique pageviews each day. In addition to the header and footer, the page consist of the following sections:

  • Marketing
  • Person search
  • Events calendar
  • News
  • Research news

Jump to the screenshots of the frontpage on diffent screen sizes.

Marketing

The content of the marketing section change depending on the season / time of the year. During the period between February 1st and April 15th this section of the page shows a mood video with links to our study program. Rest of the year this section is filled with three marketing spots and our study/course navigation.

The marketing spots include a title, an image and a button that leads to specific content elsewhere. This could be study programs, articles, conferences and other type of content that needs some extra visablitiy.

Person search

Minimalistic search-form that post into our find-employees page.

Events calendar

Two calendar entries. Design is described in the calendar component (documentation not available yet).

News

Four articles in the news category. Design is described in the article component (documentation not available yet).

Research news

Four articles in the research category. Design is described in the article component (documentation not available yet).

Box sizing

Setup all elements with box-sizing:border-box (this includes the padding in the element width)
sections.styles:
*,
*:before,
*:after {
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

sections.markup:
css
@mixin floatAndStandardSpacing(){
    float: left;
    margin-bottom: 2rem;
    padding: 0 1rem;
}
sections.styles:
@mixin floatAndStandardSpacing(){
    float: left;
    margin-bottom: 2rem;
    padding: 0 1rem;
}

sections.comment:
Layout classes

Sets the layout up using the .lo- prefix. The following options are available:

  • .lo-full{} (100% width of the parrent)
  • .lo-half{} (50% width of the parrent)
  • .lo-quarter{} (25% width of the parrent)
  • .lo-auron-1-3{} (38.2% width of the parrent)
  • .lo-auron-2-3{} (61.8% width of the parrent)
  • .lo-one-third{} (33% width of parrent)
  • .lo-two-thirds{} (66% width of parrent)

sections.styles:
.lo-full,
.lo-half,
.lo-quarter,
.lo-auron-1-3,
.lo-auron-2-3,
.lo-one-third,
.lo-two-thirds {
    @include floatAndStandardSpacing;
}

html,
#body,
.body {
    width: 100%;
}


#body,
.body {
    //padding-top: 4rem;
    min-height: 80rem;
    overflow-x: hidden;
}

#main,
.main {
    padding-top: 4rem;
}

#header,
.header,
#main,
.main,
#footer,
.footer {
    max-width: 104rem;
    margin: 0 auto;
    // IE11 fix since it lacks UA styling
    display: block;
}

#content,
.content {
    padding-left: 2rem;
    min-height: 30rem;
    > header {
        position: relative;
        //min-height: 7rem;
    }
}

#main,
.main{
  footer header {
    h2 {
        padding-left: 2rem;
    }
  }
}
.float-left {
    float: left;
}

.float-right {
    float: right;
}

html.index {
    .lo-full,
    .lo-half,
    .lo-auron-1-3,
    .lo-auron-2-3 {
        header {
            h2 {
                float: left;
            }
        }
    }
}

header.lo-full {
    padding-left: 0;
}

#content,
.content,
#sidebar,
.sidebar {
    padding-top: 2rem;
}

@include mq($until: small) {
    .lo-full,
    .lo-half,
    .lo-quarter,
    .lo-auron-1-3,
    .lo-auron-2-3,
    .lo-one-third,
    .lo-two-thirds {
        width: 100%;
    }
    #main,
    .main {
        padding-top: 0rem;
    }
    #people,
    #calendar,
    #research,
    #news {
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    #people {
        .lo-full {
            padding: 0;
        }
    }
    #calendar {
        .lo-half {
            width: 50%;
            padding: 0;
        }
    }
    #research,
    #news {
        .lo-quarter {
            padding: 0;
        }
    }
}

@include mq($from: small, $until: large) {
    .lo-full {
        width: 100%;
    }
    .lo-half {
        width: 50%;
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    .lo-one-third {
        width: 100%;
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    .lo-two-thirds {
        width: 100%;
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    .lo-quarter {
        width: 50%;
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    .lo-auron-1-3 {
        width: 100% * 0.382;
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    .lo-auron-2-3 {
        width: 100% * 0.618;
        //width: 100%;
    }
    #people,
    #calendar,
    #research,
    #news {
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    #people {
        .lo-full {
            padding: 0;
        }
    }
    #calendar {
        .lo-half {
            width: 50%;
            padding: 0;
        }
    }
    #research,
    #news {
        .lo-quarter {
            padding: 0 .5rem;
        }
    }
}

@include mq($from: large) {

    .lo-full {
        width: 100%;
    }
    .lo-half {
        width: 50%;
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    .lo-quarter {
        width: 25%;
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    .lo-auron-1-3 {
        width: 100% * 0.382;
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    .lo-auron-2-3 {
        width: 100% * 0.618;
    }
    .lo-one-third {
        width: 31%;
        margin-left: 1%;
        margin-right: 1%;
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    .lo-two-thirds {
        width: 62%;
        margin-left: 1%;
        margin-right: 1%;
        padding: 0 1rem;
    }
    .lo-first {
        padding-left: 0;
    }
    .lo-last {
        padding-right: 0;
    }
    .lo-auron-2-3 {
        .lo-quarter {}
        .lo-first {
            padding-left: 0;
        }
        .lo-last {
            padding-right: 0;
        }
    }
    #people,
    #calendar {
        padding-top: 1rem;
    }
}

@function trans($color, $percentage) {
  @return lighten($color, (1-$percentage)*5%);
}

sections.markup:
@mixin transtohex($type, $color, $percentage) {
    @if $type == color {
        color: trans($color, $percentage);
        //color: rgba($color, $percentage);
    }
    @if $type == bg {
        background-color: trans($color, $percentage);
        //background-color: rgba($color, $percentage);
    }
}
sections.styles:
@mixin transtohex($type, $color, $percentage) {
    @if $type == color {
        color: trans($color, $percentage);
        //color: rgba($color, $percentage);
    }
    @if $type == bg {
        background-color: trans($color, $percentage);
        //background-color: rgba($color, $percentage);
    }
}

$c-black: #000;
$c-white: #fff;
$c-pink: #D77869;
$c-seagreen: #6FC2B4;
$c-lightwarmgrey:#ECEAE5;
$c-warmgrey:#C8C2BE;
$c-purple:#A396A3;
$c-aquablue:#347E84;
$array: (black, $c-black), (white, $c-white), (pink, $c-pink), (seagreen, $c-seagreen), (lightwarmgrey, $c-lightwarmgrey), (warmgrey, $c-warmgrey), (purple, $c-purple), (aquablue, $c-aquablue);
$tints: (85, .85), (60, .60), (45, .45), (30, .30), (15, .15);

@each $colorname, $colorvalue in $array{
    .c-#{$colorname}{
        color: $colorvalue;
    }
}

@each $colorname, $colorvalue in $array{
    .c-bg-#{$colorname}{
        background-color: $colorvalue;
    }
}

@each $colorname, $colorvalue in $array{
    @each $tintname, $tintvalue in $tints{
      .c-#{$colorname}--tint__#{$tintname}{
          color: rgba($colorvalue, $tintvalue);
      }
    }
}

@each $colorname, $colorvalue in $array{
    @each $tintname, $tintvalue in $tints{
      .bg-#{$colorname}--tint__#{$tintname}{
          background-color: rgba($colorvalue, $tintvalue);
      }
  }
}
